answers.answer: This is a somewhat confusing question. The title Gardnerella suggests you have been reading old, outdated information. Gardnerella is just one of many bacteria that overgrow in the vagina of women with bacterial vaginosis.BV is associated with similar risks as STDs, but it's not really clear whether it is sexually acquired. Your BV may have nothing to do with your recent sexual exposure, and certainly is unrelated to his diabetes.PID is more common in women with PID, but BV itself probably doesn't cause PID. The vaginal sex was condom protected, and PID isn't known to be acquired from oral sex exposures. Some PID is not sexually acquired at all.

question: I recently had protected intercourse with a guy who has diabetes. He pleasures me orally n about 1.5 weeks later I got bacterial vaginosis. Could his diabetes have caused my balence to fall off? Due to improper treatment n a missed diagnosis I now have PID n volvovaginitis. All my std test have came back negative.
title: Gardnerella
